sentence.idiomatic: Yesterday I downloaded a lot of songs.
This lesson's MP3 file won't download.
Where can you download free movies?
Crap, the computer froze. I didn't save what i was just doing.
I saved that data on the D drive.
I've always saved all our old group photos.
Will the system automatically download updates?
To be safe, you had better update your anti-virus database every day.
Your ideas are too outdated. You had better update them a bit.
This movie is not available online.
Not only can you listen to it online, you can also download it.
Which online translation dictionary do you use?
The past few days I've gathered a lot of relevant material.
She loves to collect all kinds of guitars.
Gathering some more information will be of a lot of help to you for studying abroad.
Yesterday I was so busy. I had no time to review.
The test is coming up soon. Everybody is busy reviewing.
Let's first take a moment to review the content we studied last class.
Everyone has good ideas; you all can leave us a comment.
Everyday I go and look at the online user comments.
I have not left a comment in the forum for some time.
We are discussing where we want to go next month.
The discussions in the forums by everyone are pretty intense.
I still need to talk about this matter with everyone.
You have more than an hour. You wont be pressed for time.
You are so anxious to leave. I simply don't have the time to tell you.
If we have the time, we'll eat French food. If we don't have time, we'll just eat fast food.
How do I use ChinesePod?
It's very convenient. Download the MP3 file, save it in your MP3 player, and then you can listen to the daily updated lessons.
Can you listen online?
Yes. Each day's lesson also has a PDF file that has the Chinese, English and pinyin.
What other features are there?
There are flashcards. You can compile the vocabulary you would like to study and regularly review it.
What else is there?
You can also listen to the sentences from the dialogue, vocabulary and expansion sentences.
Really? I've heard that ChinesePod's community is also especially good.
Yeah. Everyone can leave comments on the lessons, and can leave messages for each other. Oh, and there is also a blog. Plus a lot more I don't have time to tell you about.
Do you work for them or something?
How did you know?
